Tensers lift was a ritual that allowed the caster to conjure a large magical platform that they could move with mental commands.
The spell summoned a pearlescent white hovering square platform that was  on a side. The caster could command the platform to move with their thoughts, although it was significantly faster at moving vertically than horizontally. If the caster dismissed the spell, it would not dissipate until it had gently descended to the nearest solid ground.
Tensers lift entailed material components worth 125 gold pieces.
Circa the , the Bregan Daerthe captain Xalbyn carried at least one scroll of Tensers lift, as well as the material components necessary to cast it, during his assignment in Neverwinter. This was likely always intended to be used to reach and infiltrate the Shard of Night, a mysterious hovering tower about which Bregan Daerthe wanted to learn more.
